page.title: 11 Mr. Marriott's Farm
page.content: When I went to see Mr.Marriott he said that he owned the farm because his father had owned it before him. He had been the only boy in the family and so he had to own it. The farm has about 250 acres of land used for arable farming that is growing cereal crops ( wheat, barley, and a few oats ). The farm used to be a dairy farm, producing milk, butter and cheese for sale in the village. He still has some sheep which gave him 94 lambs this year. Mr. Marriott's two sons John and Robert help him on the farm and his favourite job on the farm is ploughing, even though he lost one hand when he was young while he was playing with the combine.
